# mime-types

[![NPM Version][npm-version-image]][npm-url]
[![NPM Downloads][npm-downloads-image]][npm-url]
[![Node.js Version][node-version-image]][node-version-url]
[![Build Status][travis-image]][travis-url]
[![Test Coverage][coveralls-image]][coveralls-url]

The ultimate javascript content-type utility.

Similar to [the `mime@1.x` module](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mime), except:

- __No fallbacks.__ Instead of naively returning the first available type,
  `mime-types` simply returns `false`, so do
  `var type = mime.lookup(***REMOVED***unrecognized***REMOVED***) || ***REMOVED***application/octet-stream***REMOVED***`.
- No `new Mime()` business, so you could do `var lookup = require(***REMOVED***mime-types***REMOVED***).lookup`.
- No `.define()` functionality
- Bug fixes for `.lookup(path)`

Otherwise, the API is compatible with `mime` 1.x.

## Install

This is a [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/) module available through the
[npm registry](https://www.npmjs.com/). Installation is done using the
[`npm install` command](https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/installing-npm-packages-locally):

```sh
$ npm install mime-types
```

## Adding Types

All mime types are based on [mime-db](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mime-db),
so open a PR there if you***REMOVED***d like to add mime types.

## API

<!-- eslint-disable no-unused-vars -->

```js
var mime = require(***REMOVED***mime-types***REMOVED***)
```

All functions return `false` if input is invalid or not found.

### mime.lookup(path)

Lookup the content-type associated with a file.

<!-- eslint-disable no-undef -->

```js
mime.lookup(***REMOVED***json***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***application/json***REMOVED***
mime.lookup(***REMOVED***.md***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***text/markdown***REMOVED***
mime.lookup(***REMOVED***file.html***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***text/html***REMOVED***
mime.lookup(***REMOVED***folder/file.js***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***application/javascript***REMOVED***
mime.lookup(***REMOVED***folder/.htaccess***REMOVED***) // false

mime.lookup(***REMOVED***cats***REMOVED***) // false
```

### mime.contentType(type)

Create a full content-type header given a content-type or extension.
When given an extension, `mime.lookup` is used to get the matching
content-type, otherwise the given content-type is used. Then if the
content-type does not already have a `charset` parameter, `mime.charset`
is used to get the default charset and add to the returned content-type.

<!-- eslint-disable no-undef -->

```js
mime.contentType(***REMOVED***markdown***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***text/x-markdown; charset=utf-8***REMOVED***
mime.contentType(***REMOVED***file.json***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***application/json; charset=utf-8***REMOVED***
mime.contentType(***REMOVED***text/html***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***text/html; charset=utf-8***REMOVED***
mime.contentType(***REMOVED***text/html; charset=iso-8859-1***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***text/html; charset=iso-8859-1***REMOVED***

// from a full path
mime.contentType(path.extname(***REMOVED***/path/to/file.json***REMOVED***)) // ***REMOVED***application/json; charset=utf-8***REMOVED***
```

### mime.extension(type)

Get the default extension for a content-type.

<!-- eslint-disable no-undef -->

```js
mime.extension(***REMOVED***application/octet-stream***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***bin***REMOVED***
```

### mime.charset(type)

Lookup the implied default charset of a content-type.

<!-- eslint-disable no-undef -->

```js
mime.charset(***REMOVED***text/markdown***REMOVED***) // ***REMOVED***UTF-8***REMOVED***
```

### var type = mime.types[extension]

A map of content-types by extension.

### [extensions...] = mime.extensions[type]

A map of extensions by content-type.
